The kernel uses coalesced global memory accesses for contiguous data reads/writes.
The kernel avoids non-coalesced global memory accesses that result from strided memory patterns.
The kernel minimizes synchronization overhead by reducing the use of __syncthreads().
The kernel avoids shared memory tiling when global memory access patterns are already efficient for certain operands.
The kernel prioritizes coalesced global memory access over shared memory usage when the latter introduces unoptimized memory patterns.
